thread.title: McLennan had a tough task: Turbull
thread.title_full: McLennan had a tough task: Turbull

author: news.com.au
title: McLennan had a tough task: Turbull
text:
COMMUNICATIONS Minister Malcolm Turnbull says outgoing Ten Network boss Hamish McLennan had his work cut out for him at the struggling broadcaster.
THE chief executive and executive chairman of the company stepped down on Monday after less than two and a half years at the helm.
Mr Turnbull said Mr McLennan had been dealing with a very difficult challenge in trying to turn the network's share price around and tackle a tough advertising market. "He's very highly regarded, but he certainly had his work cut out at Ten," Mr Turnbull told reporters in Sydney on Monday. The communications minister said this was in part due to the challenges that afflict the entire television industry. "But also particularly if you're the number three network in a market which is contracting, you're in a particularly tough place," he said. "He's a very smart, experienced media executive - I think he'll go on to bigger and better things."
